posts.author: PaladinPete
posts.content:
I've been thinking about multiclass lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about multiclass that came up in our game last night.

What are the best multiclass combinations that synergize well with multiclass? I'm particularly interested in optimizing for combat effectiveness.

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about multiclass?

posts.author: MonkeyBusinessDM
posts.content:
I think the 2024 changes to multiclass make it much more balanced compared to before.

Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that multiclass functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

We had a hilarious situation where our Bard tried to use multiclass to negotiate with a dragon. It went exactly as you'd expect!

posts.author: NaturalTwenty
posts.content:
I think the 2024 changes to multiclass make it much more balanced compared to before.

How do other DMs balance encounters that involve multiclass? I find it either makes combats too easy or too difficult.

The best campaign moment I ever had involved creative use of multiclass to solve what seemed like an impossible puzzle.

posts.author: DungeonMasterDave
posts.content:
When DMing, I like to use Ranger/Paladin as a way to create interesting challenges for my players.

I think the 2024 changes to Ranger/Paladin make it much more balanced compared to before.

I've been playing a Dragonborn Monk in my campaign, and I've noticed that Ranger/Paladin really impacts how effective the character is in combat.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about Ranger/Paladin. Based on my experience, it works differently.
